docs.abstract: The N.B.A. apologizes on behalf of Daryl Morey, a general manager who voiced support for democracy.
docs.snippet: The N.B.A. apologizes on behalf of Daryl Morey, a general manager who voiced support for democracy.
docs.lead_paragraph: The national editor of this newspaper last year asked the commissioner of the N.B.A. at a conference how it felt “to be the wokest professional sports league.” It was a fair description: While Colin Kaepernick has been unable to find a job in the N.F.L. after kneeling during the national anthem to protest police brutality, basketball stars like LeBron James, Derrick Rose and Kobe Bryant have freely expressed their support for the Black Lives Matter movement, even on the court.

headline.main: The World’s Wokest Sports League Bows to China

docs.abstract: The iPhone maker acted as tech giants faced more scrutiny over what critics argue is anticompetitive behavior.
docs.snippet: The iPhone maker acted as tech giants faced more scrutiny over what critics argue is anticompetitive behavior.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN JOSE, Calif. — Over the past year, Apple purged iPhone apps that helped people limit the amount of time they and their children spent on Apple devices, drawing accusations of anticompetitive behavior.

headline.main: Apple Backs Off Crackdown on Parental-Control Apps
headline.print_headline: Apple Unbars Door to Parental-Control Apps

docs.abstract: If regulators and lawmakers are serious, they’re going to have to rethink a traditional approach to monopolies.
docs.snippet: If regulators and lawmakers are serious, they’re going to have to rethink a traditional approach to monopolies.
docs.lead_paragraph: Each week, we review the week’s news, offering analysis about the most important developments in the tech industry.

headline.main: The Week in Tech: An Emerging Twist on Antitrust
headline.print_headline: A Greener Amazon, and Tweaking Antitrust

docs.abstract: Members of Congress questioned whether the power of Facebook, Google, Apple and Amazon could hurt consumer privacy.
docs.snippet: Members of Congress questioned whether the power of Facebook, Google, Apple and Amazon could hurt consumer privacy.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — House lawmakers on Friday pressed experts on how the market power of major tech platforms could hurt consumer privacy, showing that an antitrust investigation into Facebook, Google, Apple and Amazon is growing to include deeper questions about their business models.

headline.main: In House Antitrust Hearing, Lawmakers Focus on Harms to Privacy
headline.print_headline: Antitrust Panel Asks Experts About Big Tech Hurting Privacy

docs.abstract: Samsung already assembles half of its handsets in the country, which got a big lift from U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods. Now Apple is homing in.
docs.snippet: Samsung already assembles half of its handsets in the country, which got a big lift from U.S. tariffs on Chinese goods. Now Apple is homing in.
docs.lead_paragraph: BAC NINH, Vietnam — No country on earth has benefited from President Trump’s trade fight with China more than Vietnam.

headline.main: Your Next iPhone Might Be Made in Vietnam. Thank the Trade War.

docs.abstract: For years, impostors have been posing as members of the military to bilk people out of money. Why has Facebook been unable to stop them?
docs.snippet: For years, impostors have been posing as members of the military to bilk people out of money. Why has Facebook been unable to stop them?
docs.lead_paragraph: Each week, we review the week’s news, offering analysis about the most important developments in the tech industry. Want this newsletter in your inbox? Sign up here.

headline.main: The Week in Tech: Facebook Romance Scams and Banking Hacks

byline.original: By Pui-Wing Tam and Jim Kerstetter

docs.abstract: New, more sophisticated attacks are targeting Uighurs’ phones — even iPhones and even abroad, security researchers say. They warn that foreigners could be next.
docs.snippet: New, more sophisticated attacks are targeting Uighurs’ phones — even iPhones and even abroad, security researchers say. They warn that foreigners could be next.
docs.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — China’s state-sponsored hackers have drastically changed how they operate over the last three years, substituting selectivity for what had been a scattershot approach to their targets and showing a new determination by Beijing to push its surveillance state beyond its borders.

headline.main: China Sharpens Hacking to Hound Its Minorities, Far and Wide
headline.print_headline: China Sharpens Hacking To Hound Its Minorities

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Ministry of State Security of the People's Republic of China

byline.original: By Nicole Perlroth, Kate Conger and Paul Mozur

docs.abstract: The debate over privacy in the digital age increasingly pits tech companies against law enforcement agencies as explicit imagery explodes.
docs.snippet: The debate over privacy in the digital age increasingly pits tech companies against law enforcement agencies as explicit imagery explodes.
docs.lead_paragraph: An explosion in reports of child sexual abuse imagery on the internet is prompting the authorities to step up pressure on technology companies over their use of encryption — and Facebook, which flags by far the largest amount of the material, is drawing outsize attention.

headline.main: Facebook Encryption Eyed in Fight Against Online Child Sex Abuse
headline.print_headline: Encryption Eyed in Fight Against Explicit Images

byline.original: By Jennifer Valentino-DeVries and Gabriel J.X. Dance

docs.abstract: Fifteen years after “Friends,” she is returning to TV in Apple’s “The Morning Show” as a news anchor dealing with ageism, sexism and her co-host’s misconduct.
docs.snippet: Fifteen years after “Friends,” she is returning to TV in Apple’s “The Morning Show” as a news anchor dealing with ageism, sexism and her co-host’s misconduct.
docs.lead_paragraph: LOS ANGELES — Jennifer Aniston was trying to have a quiet weekend away.

headline.main: It’s a New Morning for Jennifer Aniston
headline.print_headline: It’s a New Morning for Jennifer Aniston

docs.abstract: iOS 13, Apple’s new operating system for the iPhone, comes with tons of new tools under the hood. Here are some of the most helpful.
docs.snippet: iOS 13, Apple’s new operating system for the iPhone, comes with tons of new tools under the hood. Here are some of the most helpful.
docs.lead_paragraph: Every September, Apple offers the world a new update of its iOS software for iPhones. This year’s version, iOS 13, didn’t exactly have a graceful landing; since its release in September, Apple has produced no fewer than five follow-up versions intended to fill feature holes and fix bugs. A sixth version, 13.2, is in beta testing now.

headline.main: 16 Useful Gems in Apple’s New iOS 13
